title: Downloading replays
body:
I've noticed that there is no way to watch the games after they disappear from the match history, which is a shame.

I also noticed that it's not possible to do the same for friends, or watch replays they have dl'd or even if they hadn't, or share your replays when you want to brag about how good you were because you finally had a good team.

It would be nice if functionality for both yours and other people replays was implemented, hopefully you're working on it already and it will be out around the same time as being able to spectate games again. Missing that, have to use LoLReplay2 at the moment to watch friends games.

replies.body: I'm not sure if you know what I said....  the client has no functionality to watch the replays you dl after they are older than 20 games. Yes they're saved somewhere on my computer, but the client needs the ability to watch DL'd replays. You don't have to watch a game to dl it. I'm talking about the alpha client, not using lolreplay to dl replays, which I think for some reason you think that's what I meant.
If you're able to get a hold of the older replay file, you should be able to rename it to the name of your newest replay and play it from the client as if it were your newest replay.

It's still external file manipulation, which if you're like me and having all of your replays, inconvenient. A replay browser or some such really should be introduced. Once that is introduced a way to watch friends or pros games replays would also be handy.
Again. Not what I was talking about. They've added half functionality for it. THAT'S the point

You can record your replays, and it downloads to a folder on your computer.
But you do have to watch the whole thing in order for it to record.

I do not know if there is a way of downloading the full replay without watching it.
you can download the game from replay.gg and run it using the league replay system
